basics.name: Kai Garcia
basics.label: Software Engineer | Student
basics.summary: Kai Garcia is a senior Computer Science student at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, set to graduate in May 2025. He interned with the SDA Tap Lab, developing an automated rocket launch detection system using commercial satellite imagery. Kai also worked as a Data Engineer at Bayze, creating telemetry pipelines for analytics and machine learning. He is now conducting research at the Computational Imaging and Robotic Perception (CIRP) Lab, focusing on polarization camera systems for advanced terrain monitoring. Kai received multiple awards at the Honolulu Tech Week 2024 hackathon for developing a real-time moped theft detection system.

work.company: SDA TAP Lab - U.S. Space Force
highlights:
Developed an automated rocket launch detection system using pattern recognition algorithms with Python libraries
NumPy and OpenCV, analyzing GOES satellite IR imagery for near real-time identification and alerting of launch
events.

Designed and implemented a telemetry data pipeline using TypeScript, AWS (CloudWatch, Glue, Lambda Python
scripts, QuickSight), and Power BI, enhancing data visualization and analysis for health and retention monitoring.
Optimized data processing and AWS resource usage, reducing costs by over 90%.

Spearheaded LAMP (PHP & Typescript) project revamp, introduced advanced payment tracking for $100K+
transactions, and developed REST API, boosting financial oversight and eﬃciency.

Enhanced engineering eﬃciency and reduced errors by integrating local testing, adopting Kanban, and refining
version control, shortening production cycles.

Recruited and trained 3 developers, fostering a collaborative environment through eﬀective backlog grooming and
pair programming, enhancing team productivity by 300%.

Developed an authentication system with Firestore and Google Cloud Functions, and built a Next.js and Tailwind
CSS dashboard interfaced with a Flask app and Google BigQuery for streamlined access to 4 years of asset
management data.
Run workshops to teach entrepreneurs how to build prototypes for their ventures.
Manage inventory and budget for supplies and program costs.

volunteer.organization: Computational Imaging and Robotic Perception (CIRP) Lab
highlights: Conduct research on polarization camera systems for advanced terrain monitoring.
Develop software for data collection and analysis.

volunteer.summary: Hardware category and Audience Choice Awards
highlights:
Won Best Hardware Project and Audience Choice Award for developing a Python BLE-based mobile application
        using Swift for iOS that detects moped thefts in real-time, alerting users via the university network. The system
        utilized an Arduino Nano ESP32 and an Adafruit IMU for motion detection and communication.
10-week course in foundational AI concepts, machine learning, and ethics.
Collaborated to develop and train machine learning models using Python.
Explored real-world applications of AI, such as computer vision, natural language processing, and robotics.
